text: The n™ moment of the degree distribution is defined as o o (k™) = Y k'pr =~ [ k*p(k)dk (4.19) i, Kunin The lower moments have important interpretation: « n=1: The first moment is the average degree, (k). « n=2: The second moment, (k?), helps us calculate the variance o2 = (k%) - (k, measuring the spread in the degrees. Its square root, o, is the standard deviation. « n=3: The third moment, (k3), determines the skewness of a distribution, telling us how symmetric is py, around the average (k).
